alert.note: Alert for Central Orangeburg; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 9:53PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calhoun, northwestern Clarendon, southeastern Lexington, southwestern Sumter, north central Orangeburg and southeastern Richland Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 952 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Poinsett State Park to near St. Matthews. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sumter, South Sumter, St. Matthews, Poinsett State Park, Pinewood, Paxville, Cane Savannah, Rimini, Fort Motte, Stumphole Landing, Brogdon, Lakewood, Privateer, Wedgewood, Gable, Creston, Lone Star and Low Falls Landing. This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 128 and 141. Interstate 95 between mile markers 126 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central South Carolina.
